comments:
I20070608-1718

Got a 'Prevented recursive attempt...' warning at the beginning of my log while starting Eclipse.

Seems a bit different from bug 171605 and the like (asked Martin what he thought), hence opened this bug.

>.' warning at the beginning of my log while
>starting Eclipse.
This doesn't look like it happened while starting as I see this in the stack trace: PackageExplorerActionGroup.handleOpen

Can you please clarify.

It also looks like that file was out of sync and hence the dialog wanted to ask you whether to refresh it.

Why the Platform then tries to activated back the Package Explorer and report that error has to be answered by Platform UI.

I guess at the end it boils down to be a dup of bug 171605.

(In reply to comment #1)
> >.' warning at the beginning of my log while
> >starting Eclipse.
> This doesn't look like it happened while starting as I see this in the stack
> trace: PackageExplorerActionGroup.handleOpen
> 
> Can you please clarify.
This entry in the log is at the top and close in time to the startup timestamp. Clarification would then be: early, and at least before I started doing anything interesting (edit, build and the like).
> It also looks like that file was out of sync and hence the dialog wanted to ask
> you whether to refresh it.
Yes, this is highly likely, since several files of the workspace had been modified by external means.

> at least before I started doing anything interesting (edit, build and the like).
Well, the stack trace indicates that you at least opened the editor.

(In reply to comment #3)
> > at least before I started doing anything interesting (edit, build and the like).
> Well, the stack trace indicates that you at least opened the editor.
I'll attempt to watch my steps more closely next time.

FYI, just another one stack trace (not at startup), unfortunately I could not reproduce it:

*** Bug 203787 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fix for bug 206011 also fixes this problem.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 206011 ***
